solution_line_template: Since Randy wants to get an average of {desired_average}, then the sum of the {num_quizzes_total} quizzes should be {desired_average} x {num_quizzes_total} = <<{desired_average}*{num_quizzes_total}={total_sum_needed}>>{total_sum_needed}.
The sum of Randy's score for the first four quizzes is {score1} + {score2} + {score3} + {score4} = <<{score1}+{score2}+{score3}+{score4}={sum_first_four_quizzes}>>{sum_first_four_quizzes}.
Thus, Randy needs to get {total_sum_needed} - {sum_first_four_quizzes} = <<{total_sum_needed}-{sum_first_four_quizzes}={fifth_quiz_score}>>{fifth_quiz_score} in his fifth quiz.
